Deficiency Narrative: Evacuation plan must be posted in all buildings. The recreation room was missing one.

Four children in care indicated a staff member uses profane language with the children in care. A second staff member indicated profane language just slips out sometimes. The staff member who allegedly uses profane language claims to have not done so since being investigated by Licensing (Spring 2021), however three of the four children in care claiming profane language usage were admitted to the operation after Spring 2021 and the staff who admitted there's profane language her was hired in Spring 2022.
Correction Narrative:
This response is in reference corrective action taken concerning investigation.
Specifics: Four children in care indicated a staff member uses profane language with the children in care. A second staff member indicated profane language just slips out sometimes. The staff member who allegedly uses profane language claims to have not done so since being investigated, however three of the four children in care claiming profane language usage were admitted tp the operation after spring 2021 and the staff who admitted there's profane language was hired in spring of 2022. Action taken: Staff that allegedly uses profane language has since resigned from employment at Pathways 3H. 
Additional training on inappropriate language has been provided to the staff hired in the spring of 2022. Additional training is being provided to Pathways 3H Youth Ranch direct care team. All Direct Care Support will complete by 08/17/22.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff should not use EBI for getting a child to comply with them.
Correction Narrative:
This response is in reference corrective action concerning investigation #2892382. Standard Rule 748.1101(b)(1)(B) Childrens Rights to be free of abuse,neglect, and exploitation. Specifics A child in care was restrained and injured as a result. Standard/Rule 748.2455(a)(1) EBI Before using EBI the caregiver must attempt less restrictive interventions that prove to be ineffective. Specifics: Staff use less restrictive methods first before attempting EBI. Standard Rule 748.2455(a)(2) EBI-Basis for EBI is an emergency situation or to administer medication. Specifics-Staff should not use EBI for getting to comply with them. Action Taken: Staff involved was placed on administrative leave pending results of the investigation and has since then resigned from Pathways 3H Youth Ranch. Pathways has requested an administrative review through our attorney on all of the deficiencies related  to this.  investigation. 
  09/28/22 Face to face with Shawn Flores Director to go over follow up plan for deficiencies. He stated they are going to have treatment director to TBR monthly. They will have all staff attend. They are going to upgrade their camera system. We will have monthly EBI break downs and Shawn will be in charge of conducting those. One unit out of the ten units covers it. They will have different methods they go over before EBI implemented. Preventative techniques. They are trying to implement a youth leadership board to give insight on services and programs. They have a compliance team for all of Pathways and they review all over program and over documentation and collect data. They then ask how they want up to compile data and we let them know. The data can be focused all on EBI and help staff know what is going on. For example if they collect at the beginning of the week and see less restraints  done then they can see what they are doing to help make that change.

Deficiency Narrative: Child confirmed staff held child around the neck.
Correction Narrative:
Letter received from operation that:
Standard rule 748.2307 ( 5) Other prohibited punishment maintaining uncomfortable position

Deficiency: it was confirmed through interviews that a child was made to feel unsafe in a restraint. Those interviewed described the restraint as a hold around the neck of the child. 

Action Taken: Staff involved has submitted voluntary resignation of employment from Pathways 3 H Ranch.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member  pushed and yelled at a child in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation responded to the deficiency stating that the staff involved in the incident was terminated from employment. The operation will be providing staff with additional training on EBI to include crisis development, non-verbal and verbal intervention and control dynamics. The training will be completed by March 15, 2022.

Deficiency Narrative: The normalcy training and trauma informed care training found in the employee file were over two months late.
Correction Narrative: Annual training dates have been entered into a new (Relias) training and tracking database. The database has been set to send email reminders to the staff and trainer 30 days prior to trainings expiration.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff did not receive their emergency behavior training within the 180-day timeframe.
Correction Narrative:
Facility sent email with plan of compliance. 
This response is in reference to a heightened monitoring inspection on September 14, 2021. 

Deficiency:  748.4657(1)(A) Annual training every 6 months a caregiver must complete at least 4 hours of training in EBI. 

Specifics: One staff did not receive their emergency behavior training within the 180 day timeframe. 

Action taken: The staff referred to received their training four past 180 days timeframe. All EBI training dates have been entered. into a new training and tracking database. The database has been set to send email reminders to the staff   and trainer 30 days prior to the trainings expiration.

Technical assistance: Standard/Rule 748.3365 Bedding must provide each child with a mattress cover or protector unless mattress is waterproof. 

Specifics: It is best practice to ensure all mattress protective covers are places on childrenÂ’s beds to prevent the mattress from becoming soiled by the children sleeping on them.   
Action Taken: Upon further review by the Program manager on the day of the inspection it was discovered that the mattress covers were in place buy may have been pulled back with the fitted sheets. Mattress covers are checked at least weekly during the Physical Site Inspection and documented on the physical site inspection form.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that EBI training was incomplete for 2 staff post-6 months from the last training.
Correction Narrative: Provided documents by Administrator Joel Grimmett affirm training was completed in an adequate and timely manner. The required training certificates were misplaced during initial inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children in care indicated care givers at the operation use profane language with the children in care and had details about what words were said and it how it made the children in care feel. Multiple staff admitted to using profane language in the presence of children in care.
Correction Narrative:
Email from operation regarding citation for 748.2307 (9) Other prohibited punishment subjecting child to profane language . 

Action taken: Staff have been received additional training on Pathways 3H Youth Ranch Policy and Minimum standards for GRO on inappropriate language. 
A copy of policy, standards and training agendas for the staff are attached. 

Although we have chosen to immediately address the use of profanity at the facility, we do not feel that it was used as punishment and intend to file administrative review.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the three staff records reviewed had the following findings: One staff did not have an EBI training within the last 180 days. One staff's last EBI training was only 3.5 hours.
Correction Narrative:
1/26/2021- The administrator sent an email to show compliance. The following is the compliance response from the administrator: 

Staff record with only 3.5 hours had previously put in her two weeksÂ’ notice and is no longer employed with Pathways 3H Youth Ranch. Her employment termination date was 1-13-2021.

Staff that had not received 4 hours of EBI training was 18 days past 180 days and has since received a 4 hour refresher course. (See attached training certificate)

Staff training records  have been audited by the Administrative team and all training records are in compliance. 

To prevent future incidents, notification alerts for all staff have been set in Â“Extended ReachÂ” in order to notify the Non-Violent Crisis Prevention Intervention certified instructor 30 days prior to the employees 180 day expiration.
